From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To reset the service module hardware, software, and configuration, use the **service-module wlan-ap reset** command in privileged EXEC mode.
CLIs: service-module wlan-ap interface number reset [ bootloader | default-config ]

ParaDef.Info: The interface number for the wireless device. Always use 0.

Examples: The following example resets a wireless device on a router that is operating in either autonomous mode or LWAPP mode:
Use reset only to recover from shutdown or failed state.
The embedded device is in LWAPP mode. Reload/reset is normally handled by WLC controller.
Resetting the Factory Default Configuration on the Wireless Device
The following example resets the wireless device to the default configuration.
Recovering the Image on the Wireless Device
The following example resets the wireless device down to the bootloader level for manual image recovery.
ExtraInfo: At the confirmation prompt, press **Enter** to confirm the action, or press **n** to cancel.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/caut.gif)---**Caution** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Because you may lose data, use the**service-module wlan-ap reset** command only to recover from a shutdown or failed state.---

RelatedCmds.description: Enters wireless interface configuration mode to configure an interface.
Performs a graceful shutdown and reboot of the service module.
